properties.name: bold
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the comment text is bold.

examples.description: Make all text in a comment content range bold

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a CommentContentRange object to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application before performing operations on comment content.

properties.name: hyperlink
properties.description: Gets the first hyperlink in the range, or sets a hyperlink on the range. All hyperlinks in the range are deleted when you set a new hyperlink on the range.

examples.description: Set a hyperlink to "https://www.example.com" on the content range of a comment

properties.name: isEmpty
properties.description: Checks whether the range length is zero.

examples.description: Check if a comment content range is empty and display an alert message based on the result

properties.name: italic
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the comment text is italicized.

examples.description: Make all text in a comment's content range italic

properties.name: strikeThrough
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates whether the comment text has a strikethrough.

examples.description: Apply strikethrough formatting to the text content of a comment in the document

properties.name: text
properties.description: Gets the text of the comment range.

examples.description: Read and display the text content from a comment range in the document

properties.name: underline
properties.description: Specifies a value that indicates the comment text's underline type. 'None' if the comment text isn't underlined.

examples.description: Apply a double underline style to text within a comment content range

methods.name: insertText
methods.description: Inserts text into at the specified location. Note: For the modern comment, the content range tracked across context turns to empty if any revision to the comment is posted through the UI.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to be inserted in to the CommentContentRange.

examples.description: Insert the text "Please review this section carefully." at the beginning of a comment's content range in a Word document.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: `propertyNamesAndPaths.select` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and `propertyNamesAndPaths.expand` is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the text content of a comment content range associated with a comment in the document.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

examples.description: Update multiple properties of a comment content range to highlight and format a specific portion of text within a comment

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.CommentContentRange object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CommentContentRangeData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Get a JSON representation of a comment content range to log or store its properties for debugging purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a comment content range object to maintain its reference across multiple sync calls when highlighting the text within a comment's content range.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Load a comment content range, use its properties, then untrack it to free memory when done.
